meanings.definition: A system of government in which priests rule in the name of a god.
meanings.sent1: In some theocracies, priests have the power to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: Theocracies can be found in various parts of the world.
meanings.sent3: The theocracies in fantasy books often have magical priests.
meanings.sent4: Theocracies of the past were like divine kingdoms on earth.
meanings.sent5: Theocracies are like governments led by spiritual leaders.

meanings.definition: Theocracies is the plural form of the word theocracy.
meanings.sent1: We studied the plural form theocracies in our grammar class.
meanings.sent2: The term theocracies is used when referring to multiple theocratic systems.
meanings.sent3: The teacher explained that theocracies means more than one theocracy.
meanings.sent4: Theocracies sounds like a complex word, but it just means multiple theocracies.
meanings.sent5: When discussing different types of government, we must remember the plural theocracies.
